channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024010089
item.description:
Report X-2024010089

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-26
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WERE PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL PPE/TUBS WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report X-2023120609
item.description:
Report X-2023120609

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: SPOKANE VALLEY
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO QA BECAUSE IT WAS WET, TAKEN OFF BELT AND TRANSFERED TO RED LINED TOTE. DescribePack: THE SECONDARY SEALS APPEAR TO BE LOCATION OF FAILURE, BUT NEVER EXACTLY INDENTIFIED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: TRANSFERED TO RED LINED TOTE
